channel.title: The Top 10 Programming Languages of 2012 - A good end to this lovely year
channel.description:
The knowledge of a handful of programming languages could come to be a lifesaver to many a programmer, especially since most languages that were popular 10 years ago are not as viable as they are now.
But there are many developers who have earned their worth simply by knowing the right programming language at the right time, simply because they had solid skills that were profitable while the language was popular.
Here are some languages though, which stayed popular through the years, and prove to give young developers a jumpstart to their careers, and always are a bonus to add to any developer’s resume, as compiled by TIOBE software, a coding standards company.
[hr]
10: JavaScript
[img]http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-I7Nw5_zP1aI/T0YR7rTeSwI/AAAAAAAABAo/GqqV8aw_gz0/s1600/Java_ScriptLogo.jpg[/img]
[u][b]What is it?[/b][/u] JavaScript is an object-oriented scripting language that is smaller than Java. Being a client-side language, it runs in the web browser on the client-side with a simplified set of commands, easier code and no need for compilation.
[u][b]Why is it important?[/b][/u] JavaScript is simple to learn and is the tenth most widely used programming language. It is used in millions of web pages to authenticate forms, detect browsers and improve design, and it is easier to run these functions as it is embedded into HTML.
[hr]
9: Perl
[img]http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-rF4_5DTPzfw/T0YR8rMEtMI/AAAAAAAABBE/S5XdWcWBQws/s1600/Perl_Programming_language.gif[/img]
[u][b]What is it?[/b][/u] Being a high-level programming language, its emphasis lies in code readability and clear syntax. It combines Object-oriented and functional programming styles, and is often used as a scripting language. Perl is an open-source language used widely to process text through CGI programs.
[u][b]Why is it important?[/b][/u] Perl’s efficiency in processing of piles of text has ranked it ninth in terms of programming language popularity. It is used extensively to write Web server programs for a variety of tasks. “Learning some form of scripting language, such as Perl or PHP is critical if you are doing Web apps," told Wayne Duqaine, director of Software Development at Grandview Systems, of Sebastopol, Calif., in a talk with eWEEK.
[hr]
8: Python
[img]http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-IEUrKA_ZNBs/T0YR9j2AOvI/AAAAAAAABBQ/fvrkRGbOXgM/s320/python-Programming_language.png[/img]
[u][b]What is it?[/b][/u] This is an event-driven programming language which is extensively used by Google because of its simplicity. It is managed by the Python Software Foundation.
[u][b]Why is it important?[/b][/u] Python is a general-purpose, high-level programming language whose design philosophy emphasizes code readability. Python claims to combine "remarkable power with very clear syntax", and its standard library is large and comprehensive.
[hr]
7: (Visual) Basic
[img]http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-WGD3wqr-wDo/T0YR-k4GqpI/AAAAAAAABBc/r1ogxHghpv8/s640/Visual_Basic_Programming_Language.png[/img]
[u][b]What is it?[/b][/u] This is an event-driven programming language which is implemented on Microsoft’s .Net framework.
[u][b]Why is it important?[/b][/u] This language ranked as the seventh most popular language on TIOBE’s list, probably because it was designed by Microsoft to be easy to learn and use. According to Tim Huckaby, CEO of San Diego-based software engineering company CEO Interknowlogy.com, “It is currently dominating in adoption and that is where all the work is,” as in eWEEK’s report.
[hr]
6: PHP
[img]http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-ksCpwga9UiM/T0YR8ZCdjnI/AAAAAAAABBA/pPywkcoY4-k/s200/PHP_Programming_Language.jpg[/img]
[u][b]What is it?[/b][/u] This language is especially suited for Web development because of it easy embedding into HTML pages. It is an open-source, server-side, cross-platform, interpretive HTML scripting language
[u][b]Why is it important?[/b][/u] It is a popular language, ranking sixth on TIOBE’s list. "High-speed scripting with caching, augmented with compiled code plug-ins (such as can be done with Perl and PHP) is where the future is. Building Web apps from scratch using C or COBOL is going the way of the dinosaur," said Duquaine, according to eWEEK’s report.
[hr]
5: Objective-C
[img]http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-oVyjLtedIZA/T0YR8LffBJI/AAAAAAAABAw/7MUEG-e0exw/s200/Objective_C_Programmin_Language.png[/img]
[u][b]What is it?[/b][/u] This object-oriented programming language created first by Brad Cox and Tom Love at their company Stepstone in the early 1980s, adds Smalltalk-like messaging to the C programming language.
[u][b]Why is it important?[/b][/u] This language is most used on the Apple iOS and Mac OS X. Objective-C is the principal language used for Apple's Cocoa API as well.
[hr]
4. C++
[img]http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-aub1p_K9GmA/T0YR6pw5sRI/AAAAAAAABAc/2CF6tPRfCLA/s200/C%252B%252B_Programming_language.png[/img]
[u][b]What is it?[/b][/u] C++ is a general purpose multi-paradigm spanning compiled language that has both high-level and low-level languages’ features. It was started as an enhancement to the C programming language, Bjarne Stroustrup in 1979.
[u][b]Why is it important?[/b][/u] It is one of the most popular programming languages, winning fourth place on the list, with application domains including systems software, application software, server and client applications, and entertainment software such as video games. The language has also greatly influenced many other popular programming languages, such as C# and Java.
[hr]
3: C#
[img]http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-4j1aBze_D2E/T0YR7PPs3xI/AAAAAAAABAk/iA_WE3y9Ydg/s1600/C_Sharp_Programming_Language.png[/img]
[u][b]What is it?[/b][/u] This general-purpose programming language developed by Microsoft evolved from C and C++ as a part of the software company’s .NET initiative.
[u][b]Why is it important?[/b][/u] This language is an essential part of the .NET framework, so developers who use Microsoft heavily will find it critical, according to Duqaine.
[hr]
2: C
[img]http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-inVPpkA2gdQ/T0YR6_9UiiI/AAAAAAAABAg/ILWWdhDSApA/s200/C_Programming_Language.jpg[/img]
[u][b]What is it?[/b][/u] C, a general purpose programming language built by Dennis Ritchie when he was a part of Bell Telephone labs, is the bass of C++ and other programming languages. It was built to work with the Unix operating system.
[u][b]Why is it important?[/b][/u] C is one of the most widely used programming languages of all time, and ranked second on the list. “Learning C is crucial. Once you learn C, making the jump to Java or C# is fairly easy, because a lot of the syntax is common. Also, a lot of C syntax is used in scripting languages,” Wayne Duqaine, director of Software Development at Grandview Systems, of Sebastopol, Calif., told eWEEK.
[hr]
1: Java
[img]http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-78tGzB2tghA/T0YR8C1cPzI/AAAAAAAABA4/TQTvgKagGQA/s200/Java_Programming_Language.jpg[/img]
[u][b]What is it?[/b][/u] An object-oriented programming language developed in the late 1990s by James Gosling and colleagues at Sun Microsystems.
[u][b]Why is it important?[/b][/u] This “beautiful” programming language is central for any non-Microsoft developer, i.e. any developer who focuses on the non-.NET experience. It is mostly derived from C and C++ but has a more basic object model. It ranked first on TIOBE’s list of most popular programming languages.
[hr]
So I thought this'd be a good end to the new year. Wanna learn some of these languages? Then look at [url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,595376.0.html]this[/url] thread!
So, thoughts?

item.title: The Top 10 Programming Languages of 2012 - A good end to this lovely year
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

Fire capez:

This list is actually based on popularity or so I assume it is because no one in their right mind would put visual basic on a list of the top ten programming languages.

Neither would a sensible person put PHP on that same list, cuz screw PHP.

Read full topic

item.title: The Top 10 Programming Languages of 2012 - A good end to this lovely year
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“arham 4, post:5, topic:477209”][quote author=Taharok link=topic=595402.msg4192459#msg4192459 date=1357013919]
What criteria is used in judging these? I find these “top ten” lists are very biased or just don’t make any sense. These are probably among the most used, but that doesn’t mean they are the best by that order, by any means. It’s completely arbitrary.
[/quote]
Based by the amount of people who use the language, not efficiency.[/quote]

Efficiency is equally arbitrary.

Read full topic
